premise: Only the half of the square that lies inside the field contributes to the magnetic flux.
conclusion: That area is Ainside = ½ a².
Initial flux: Φi = n B Ainside = n B (½ a²).
Final flux: Φf = n (2B) Ainside = n (2B) (½ a²) = n B a².

premise: Initial flux: Φi = n B (½ a²). Final flux: Φf = n B a².
conclusion: Change in flux: ΔΦ = Φf − Φi = n B a² − n B (½ a²) = ½ n B a².
By Faraday’s law, the magnitude of the induced emf is |𝓔| = |ΔΦ| / Δt.

premise: Change in flux: ΔΦ = ½ n B a². By Faraday’s law, |𝓔| = |ΔΦ| / Δt.

conclusion: Therefore, the induced emf in the coil is 𝓔 = n B a² ⁄ (2 Δt).
